sn15.6:4.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn15.6:4.6: It’s not easy to calculate how many years, how many hundreds or thousands or hundreds of thousands of years it lasts.”
sn15.6:5.1: “But sir, can you give a simile?”
sn15.6:5.3: “Suppose there was an iron city, a league long, a league wide, and a league high, full of mustard seeds pressed into balls.
sn15.6:5.4: And as each century passed someone would remove a single mustard seed.
sn15.6:5.5: By this means the huge heap of mustard seeds would be used up before the eon comes to an end.
sn15.6:5.6: That’s how long an eon is.
sn15.6:5.7: And we’ve transmigrated through many such eons, many hundreds, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands.
sn15.6:5.10: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed from all conditions.”
